Here are some effective strategies for optimizing the performance of cloud computing platforms in data-intensive applications:

1. Data Management: Optimize data storage, processing and retrieval for efficient data management. Use distributed file systems to improve the speed of data processing and retrieval.

2. Resource Allocation: Allocate resources dynamically based on workload and demand to avoid overprovisioning or underprovisioning of resources. Use auto-scaling to adjust the number of servers or virtual machines in response to changes in demand.

3. Network Configuration: Optimize the network configuration for efficient communication between different components of the application. Use load balancing, caching, and content delivery networks to improve network performance.

4. Performance Monitoring: Use performance monitoring tools to track the performance of the application and identify bottlenecks or performance issues. Use real-time monitoring to detect and fix issues before they cause a significant impact.

5. Optimization of Algorithms: Optimize the algorithms used in the application for better performance. Use parallel processing, vectorization, and other optimization techniques to improve the performance of complex computations.

6. Security Optimization: Implement security measures to protect data residing in the cloud environment as well as third-party entities that may grant access to the data. 

In summary, optimizing the performance of cloud computing platforms in data-intensive applications requires a combination of various strategies with data management, resource allocation, network configuration, performance monitoring, optimization of algorithms, and security optimization among the most critical.
